samples.question: Are you ready to begin?

samples.question: Can you elaborate on that a bit?
samples.transcript: Yes, definitely. Most projects need careful planning and a deadline, such as the budgeting plan that I did with Hue. And also some, oh. Go ahead. Also some, projects need unique solutions, like a viral Facebook ad campaign.

samples.question: What are some of the most important steps when starting a project?
samples.transcript: The critical stages when beginning a project are assessment, planning, and execution. These are important to reach optimal results.
samples.transcript_original: The critical stages when beginning a project are assessment, planning, and execution. These are important to reach optimal results.
samples.transcript_cleaned: The critical stages when beginning a project are assessment, planning, and execution. These are important to reach optimal results.

samples.question: How about after finishing a project?
samples.transcript: After project completion, feedback and reassessment are important. So that if we encounter future similar projects, they could yield even better results. This was the final step in who is in my budgeting plan that I discussed in part two.
samples.transcript_original: After project completion, feedback and reassessment are important. So that if we encounter future similar projects, they could yield even better results. This was the final step in who is in my budgeting plan that I discussed in part two.

samples.question: How has technology helped people and companies manage their projects more efficiently?
samples.transcript: Technology has greatly aided entities of all kind, either in organization or execution.
samples.transcript_original: Technology has greatly aided entities of all kind, either in organization or execution.

samples.question: Is technology always helpful?
samples.transcript: Technology is helpful 99% of the time, but of course it can be negative, for example in brainstorming or creativity. Traditional pen and paper may still hold the advantages.

samples.question: Why is it a good idea to work together with other people on difficult assignments?
samples.transcript: As the saying goes, two heads are better than one. In all seriousness, different people bring different perspectives to the challenges we face. So it is definitely a good idea to collaborate with others, such as Huy and I did.

samples.question: When can this be a problem instead of a benefit?
samples.transcript: Some teams lack cohesion. And this may lead to a diffusion of responsibility and incompetence.
samples.transcript_original: Some teams lack cohesion. And this may lead to a diffusion of responsibility and incompetence.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Some teams lack cohesion. And this may lead to a diffusion of responsibility and incompetence.

samples.question: What are good ways to create effective teamwork?
samples.transcript: To kick off a team project efficiently, first the members' strengths and weaknesses should be assessed. So that in that way, tasks can be divided based on those to exploit each member's strengths and compensate for their weaknesses.
samples.transcript_original: To kick off a team project efficiently, first the members' strengths and weaknesses should be assessed. So that in that way, tasks can be divided based on those to exploit each member's strengths and compensate for their weaknesses.

samples.question: Did you have a favourite book when you were a child?

samples.question: How much reading do you do for your work or studies?

samples.question: Do you prefer x or y?
samples.transcript: But Tim starts by saying, yeah, I think so. He does not state a preference here. So it is a little bit unclear what he means. A better way to start would be by saying which one he prefers. For example, I find reading newspapers online much more convenient. He does a good job of explaining his reasons though. He says he can access them easily on his phone and that they are cheaper and he ends with a great phrase in just one click. This is a very natural use of an idiomatic phrase. let us keep watching.
